A constraint ensuring all values in a column are distinct
A constraint that ensures values in a column satisfy a specific condition

q: Can a unique constraint contain NULL values?
o: Yes, typically one NULL value is allowed
A primary key composed of two or more columns
A column or set of columns that could serve as a primary key
A column or set of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table

q: Can a primary key contain NULL values?
o: No, primary keys cannot contain NULL values

q: Can a table have multiple primary keys?
o: No, a table can have only one primary key
